byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Maher Samaan from Paris.

abstract: Syrian government allows one humanitarian truck convoy into Damascus suburb that has been blockaded since 2012, response apparently meant to forestall United Nations plans to airdrop aid to rebel-held areas; aid workers, opposition figures and Western officials caution that supplies delivered did not have any food, which area urgently needs.

headline.print_headline: Syria Allows Limited Aid Into a Blockaded Town
headline.main: Syria, Facing Deadline, Allows Limited Aid to Besieged Town of Daraya

keywords.value: International Committee of the Red Cross
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: Aid groups and opposition figures said the delivery was minimal and appeared intended to forestall a United Nations commitment to begin airdrops of food.
lead_paragraph: Aid groups and opposition figures said the delivery was minimal and appeared intended to forestall a United Nations commitment to begin airdrops of food.
